j_cumps wrote:

>  > If the code was developed with TDD, will there really be much unused
>  > code kicking around?
> 
> Some code might just exist because we've written a test for it.

Some code might just exist because we've written a requirement for it. 
This is not a statement about TDD, but rather a statement about removing 
unneeded code when we know we don't need it. We should do that 
regularly, whether we practice TDD or not. I find that it's easier to do 
that safely when there are more tests.

> I was not talking about integration testing. But indeed I am thinking
> about testing at a higher level within the unit itself.

I think you define "integration testing" differently than I do. Can you 
give an example of this "high-level unit test" that is not an 
integration test?
